pros: Good insurance, nice amount of PTO. I like the people in my department, and we work well together

review_title: Lots of Work for Salary but Relaxed Atmosphere
pros: Supervisor is very relaxed, helpful, and understanding. Largely left to teach your classes as you'd like to.
cons: Pay is not great, no guarantee of rehire year by year

pros: Faculty and students are amazing overall.
cons: This is a HIGHLY toxic work environment in ways that directly undermine and demean faculty. The administration usurps faculty expertise in ways that have lead to the erosion of shared governance and academic freedom. If you are in a tenure track position in certain departments, it’s likely you will be positioned as a clinical professor and be held to high publication expectations (publish or perish mentality). The course loads and classes sizes are problematic in some departments. You will be expected to teach across both campuses which are 40-50 mins apart without gas compensation. Racism (as seen in the national spotlight) is an everyday reality. Do your homework before applying/accepting a position here.
